ygData.subject: Re: Lava Bath. don't try this at home
ygData.msgSnippet: Blade trap?  I saw that decoration and didn t even realize it might be a trap.  So I walked right into it.  And nothing happened at all.  In fact, until
ygData.messageBody:
Blade trap? I saw that "decoration" and didn't even realize it might be a
trap. So I walked right into it. And nothing happened at all. In fact,
until someone else mentioned the word trap in-game, I didn't even think that
was what it might be. The next time I was there, I stood under it, and
still, no effect. I never take damage from it. Has anyone out there ever
been damaged by it?


----- Original Message -----
From: Bob <vampyre@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Wednesday, November 24, 1999 10:39 AM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Lava Bath. don't try this at home


> From: Bob <vampyre@...>
>
> Hi all,
>
> List sems to be dieing down so I thought I'd share my experience with
> lava.
> I was in soulsek A and trying to go through the window instead of taking a
> chance with the swinging blade trap. I was also invisable at the time.
> Well I got stuck in the window. Suddenly I popped out and fell backwards
> into the lava pool. At the time I had major shield, Leather Skin and
> Elemntal Protextion on me. At first I nearly paniced but then I started
> banging my 6 key. It was my hot key for gate. The whole time I was
thinking
> that this was the end, and I'd never get my corps back. After two tries, I
> got a gate off. When I materialized at m bind point, I had 22 hp left.
> From what I hear, I can consider myself extreamly lucky to have lived. I
> think I would have been a lot luckier if I had not fell in at all.
>
> >
